transportAdvice: Vancouver has an extensive public transit network including a rapid transit rail system, buses, and a sea bus ferry, which together cover most tourist areas and neighbourhoods effectively. The downtown core and waterfront areas are very walkable, and taxis as well as ride-hailing services are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and rainy with overcast skies; snow is rare at sea level but possible on surrounding mountains.
Still wet and grey with occasional mild breaks; early signs of spring blossoms begin to appear.
Rain continues but days grow longer and cherry blossoms begin to bloom across the city.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with a mix of showers and sunny spells; a lovely time to explore parks.
Warm and mostly comfortable with occasional rain; outdoor activities become very appealing.
Early summer brings warm, mostly dry days ideal for hiking, cycling, and waterfront activities.
The driest and sunniest month of the year with warm temperatures and long daylight hours.
Consistently warm and sunny, making it peak season for outdoor recreation and festivals.
Early autumn is mild and often sunny with comfortable temperatures and fewer crowds than summer.
Rain returns more frequently and temperatures drop; fall foliage adds colour to parks and trails.
Wet and cool with persistent overcast conditions; a quieter time to visit with lower accommodation rates.
Cold and rainy at sea level while nearby mountains receive heavy snowfall; festive city atmosphere downtown.
